instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> randomly crashing when battery connected
threads.message:
Hi,

This board will randomly crash when the cable at J6951 is connected. It will happen during boot or when MacOS is fully loaded.
During boot, for a split second the apple logo will sometimes have a red square background and the loading bar becomes green. 
The it will go into boot loop or get stuck not turning on at all.
When J6951 is not connected (no battery power), it seems to run fine.
<SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> is 0.02V, <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3G_SCL</SIGNAL> and .._SDA are both 3.38V, no shorts to ground.
Putting the logic board in another topcase shows same symptoms.
Also tried another SSD and external drive. 
Owner says it happened after OS update. Then he changed the SSD and it was fine for 3 days. Has been showing these symptoms since.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> randomly crashing when battery connected
threads.message: If happened after OS update, first step is to reflash BIOS with known good working file, clean ME.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> randomly crashing when battery connected
threads.message:
So I flashed the BIOS with a cleaned ME I found at win-raid forum, but it's still showing same behaviour. 
All others images I tried from other websites either don't turn on at all or get stuck during boot screen.
Do you have image(s) i could try?
Maybe it's a HW issue after all? What could I check?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> randomly crashing when battery connected
threads.message:
Did you try to start in safe mode?
Also try SMC bypass.

What is the 820-xxxxx code?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> randomly crashing when battery connected
threads.message:
No, but i will, once re-install finishes (can do while battery disconnected).
It's a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A EMC 3164.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> randomly crashing when battery connected
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> randomly crashing when battery connected
threads.message:
It crashes in safe mode and with the image you provided.
I can only bypass SMC if i disconnect battery (J6951). It's taking awfully long, though...still loading.
But I'm not sure how this will help as the board will only crash when J6951 is connected.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> randomly crashing when battery connected
threads.message: In bypass mode, the progress bar is at around the middle and hasn't been moving for 20 minutes now.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> randomly crashing when battery connected
threads.message: Can you boot Windows on it?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> randomly crashing when battery connected
threads.message:
I tried installing via Boot Camp. After restart, it tries to boot into the Windows Installer, but gives <SIGNAL>ACPI_BIOS_ERROR</SIGNAL> right at the beginning.
I did this all while J6951 is disconnected.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> randomly crashing when battery connected
threads.message: You should see what happens with battery properly connected from the beginning.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> randomly crashing when battery connected
threads.message: Same error with battery connected. Blue Windows screen with <SIGNAL>ACPI_BIOS_ERROR</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> randomly crashing when battery connected
threads.message: I just tried ubuntu from a pendrive. The OS froze after generating some CPU load.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> randomly crashing when battery connected
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7210</CHIP>/20 can cause the problem.
You can try to change them...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> randomly crashing when battery connected
threads.message: I changed both, not it doesn't turn on at all. Drawing only 290mA. Did i toast the CPU?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> randomly crashing when battery connected
threads.message:
Depends on the heat applied to CPU.
Check first for knocked off components (both sides of board) and be sure to have good solders.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> randomly crashing when battery connected
threads.message:
i needed lots of heat to get them off, because the heat sink was still. maybe i should have removed it.
PPVCCCPU is 0.95 initially, then drops to 0.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> randomly crashing when battery connected
threads.message:
Pufff, heatsink must be always removed, when apply heat near CPU.
The heatsink maintained the CPU die with high temps for long time and pressure could damaged it also.
